net.sf.iptablesJava.rules

Class IPTables

  • Object
    • net.sf.iptablesJava.rules.IPTables

  • public class IPTables
extends Object
    Interact directly with the system iptables application. To execute correctly make sure that the application has the correct unix permissions to access the iptables commands

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentRules

        public static RuleSet getCurrentRules()
                               throws IOException
        Returns:
        The RuleSet that represent the current system configuration
        Throws:
        IOException - If the operation cannot be completed, for example for insufficient privileges or unsupported iptables version

      • applyRules

        public static void applyRules(RuleSet set)
                       throws IOException
        Apply the specified RuleSet to the system configuration
        Throws:
        IOException - If the operation cannot be completed, for example for insufficient privileges or unsupported iptables version
        NullPointerException - If the passed ruleset is null

      • insertRule

        public static void insertRule(Rule rule,
              int ruleNum,
              RuleSet.TableType table)
                       throws IOException
        Insert a rule at the specified position
        Parameters:
        rule - The rule to insert, the rule must be associated with a chain, else an IllegalArgumentExceptin will be thrown
        ruleNum - The 1-indexed position where to insert
        table - The table where to insert the rule, if null the default table is FILTER
        Throws:
        IOException - If the operation cannot be completed, for example for insufficient privileges or unsupported iptables version
        IllegalArgumentException - If the rule is not associated with a chain
        NullPointerException - If the passed rule is null

      • replaceRule

        public static void replaceRule(Rule newRule,
               int ruleNum,
               RuleSet.TableType table)
                        throws IOException
        Replace a rule in the specified position
        Parameters:
        newRule - The replacement rule
        ruleNum - The 1-indexed position where the rule to replace is
        table - The table where the rule to replace is, if null the default table is FILTER
        Throws:
        IOException - If the operation cannot be completed, for example for insufficient privileges or unsupported iptables version
        IllegalArgumentException - If the rule is not associated with a chain
        NullPointerException - If the passed rule is null

      • appendRule

        public static void appendRule(Rule rule,
              RuleSet.TableType table)
                       throws IOException
        Append a rule at the end of the chain
        Parameters:
        rule - The rule to append
        table - The table where to append the rule, if null the default table is FILTER
        Throws:
        IOException - If the operation cannot be completed, for example for insufficient privileges or unsupported iptables version
        IllegalArgumentException - If the rule is not associated with a chain
        NullPointerException - If the passed rule is null

      • deleteRule

        public static void deleteRule(Rule rule,
              RuleSet.TableType table)
                       throws IOException
        Delete the specified rule
        Parameters:
        rule - The rule to delete
        table - The table where the rule to delete is, if null the default table is FILTER
        Throws:
        IOException - If the operation cannot be completed, for example for insufficient privileges or unsupported iptables version
        IllegalArgumentException - If the rule is not associated with a chain
        NullPointerException - If the passed rule is null

      • deleteRule

        public static void deleteRule(int ruleNum,
              RuleSet.TableType table,
              String chain)
                       throws IOException
        Delete the rule at the specified position
        Parameters:
        ruleNum - The 1-indexed position where the rule to delete is
        table - The table where the rule to delete is, if null the default table is FILTER
        chain - The chain where the rule to delete is
        Throws:
        IOException - If the operation cannot be completed, for example for insufficient privileges or unsupported iptables version
